summary.span: 表示 16 位元不帶正負號的整數 (Unsigned Integer)。

span.span: Represents a 16-bit unsigned integer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 實值型別代表不帶正負號的整數，範圍從 0 到 65535 的值。The value type represents unsigned integers with values ranging from 0 to 65535. > [!IMPORTANT] > 類型不符合 CLS 標準。The type is not CLS-compliant. 符合 CLS 規範替代型別是。The CLS-compliant alternative type is . 可以改為用來取代值，範圍從 0 到。 can be used instead to replace a value that ranges from zero to . 如需 CLS 合規性的詳細資訊，請參閱[Language Independence and Language-independent Components](~/docs/standard/language-independence-and-language-independent-components.md)。For more information about CLS compliance, see [Language Independence and Language-Independent Components](~/docs/standard/language-independence-and-language-independent-components.md). 結構會提供方法比較此類型的執行個體，將執行個體的值轉換成其字串表示法，並將數字的字串表示轉換成此型別的執行個體。The structure provides methods to compare instances of this type, convert the value of an instance to its string representation, and convert the string representation of a number to an instance of this type. 格式規格的程式碼的實值類型的字串表示的控制方式的相關資訊，請參閱[格式化型別](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For information about how format specification codes control the string representation of value types, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法會實作介面並執行稍微優於方法因為並沒有將`value`物件的參數。This method implements the interface and performs slightly better than the method because it does not have to convert the `value` parameter to an object. 根據您的程式語言，可能是程式碼可能方法的參數類型具有較少的位元的位置 （較窄） 與執行個體類型。Depending on your programming language, it might be possible to code a method where the parameter type has fewer bits (is narrower) than the instance type. 這可能是因為有些程式語言會執行隱含的擴展轉換，將參數表示為型別具有相同位元數與執行個體。This is possible because some programming languages perform an implicit widening conversion that represents the parameter as a type with as many bits as the instance. 例如，假設此執行個體類型是，且參數類型為。For example, suppose the instance type is and the parameter type is . Microsoft C# 編譯器會產生代表做為參數的值的指示物件，則會產生比較的值的方法執行個體和參數表示法。The Microsoft C# compiler generates instructions to represent the value of the parameter as an object, then generates a method that compares the values of the instance and the parameter representation. 請參閱您的程式語言的文件，以判斷其編譯器是否會執行隱含的擴展轉換數值類型上。Consult your programming language's documentation to determine whether its compiler performs implicit widening conversions on numeric types. ## Examples 下列範例示範泛型和非泛型版本數的值和參考類型的方法。The following example demonstrates generic and nongeneric versions of the method for several value and reference types. span.para: 編譯器多載解析可能會說明行為中的兩個明顯的差別方法多載。如果之間的隱含轉換引數和定義和引數型別不是作為，編譯器會執行隱含轉換和呼叫方法。否則，呼叫方法，它一定會傳回如果其引數不是值。下列範例說明這兩個方法多載之間的行為差異。若是值，傳回第一個比較因為編譯器會自動執行擴展轉換和呼叫方法，而第二個比較會傳回因為編譯器會呼叫方法。 [！ 的程式碼 csharp[System.UInt16.Equals#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.uint16.equals/cs/equalsoverl.cs#1)] [！ 的程式碼 vb[System.UInt16.Equals#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.uint16.equals/vb/equalsoverl.vb#1)]

Compiler overload resolution may account for an apparent difference in the behavior of the two method overloads. If an implicit conversion between the argument and a is defined and the argument is not typed as an , compilers perform an implicit conversion and call the method. Otherwise, they call the method, which always returns if its argument is not a value. The following example illustrates the difference in behavior between the two method overloads. In the case of a value, the first comparison returns because the compiler automatically performs a widening conversion and calls the method, whereas the second comparison returns because the compiler calls the method. [!code-csharp[System.UInt16.Equals#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.uint16.equals/cs/equalsoverl.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.UInt16.Equals#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.uint16.equals/vb/equalsoverl.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks `s`參數應該是下列格式之數字的字串表示。The `s` parameter should be the string representation of a number in the following form. [*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*][*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space.| |*簽署**sign*|選擇性正負號。An optional sign. 有效的符號字元由和目前文化特性的屬性。Valid sign characters are determined by the and properties of the current culture. 不過，使用負號，只使用零;否則，此方法會擲回。However, the negative sign symbol can be used only with zero; otherwise, the method throws an .| |*digits**digits*|範圍從 0 到 9 的數字順序。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9. 任何前置的零都會被忽略。Any leading zeros are ignored.| > [!NOTE] > 所指定的字串`s`參數會解譯使用樣式。The string specified by the `s` parameter is interpreted by using the style. 它不能包含任何的群組分隔符號或小數分隔符號，而且不得有小數部分。It cannot contain any group separators or decimal separator, and it cannot have a decimal portion. `s`參數會剖析使用的格式設定資訊中初始化目前系統文化特性的物件。The `s` parameter is parsed by using the formatting information in a object that is initialized for the current system culture. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱。For more information, see . 若要將字串剖析使用特定文化特性格式資訊，請使用方法。To parse a string by using the formatting information of a specific culture, use the method. ## Examples 下列範例會呼叫方法，將字串陣列中的每個項目轉換成不帶正負號的 16 位元整數。The following example calls the method to convert each element in a string array to an unsigned 16-bit integer. remarks.format:
## Remarks `style`參數定義中允許的樣式項目 （例如空白字元、 正數或負數符號、 群組分隔符號或小數點符號）`s`剖析作業成功的參數。The `style` parameter defines the style elements (such as white space, the positive or negative sign symbol, the group separator symbol, or the decimal point symbol) that are allowed in the `s` parameter for the parse operation to succeed. `style` 必須是從位元旗標組合列舉型別。`style` must be a combination of bit flags from the enumeration. `style`參數可讓這個方法多載有用的時機`s`包含十六進位值的字串表示，當所表示之數字系統，（十進位或十六進位）`s`已知只能在執行階段，或當您不允許空白字元，或登符號在`s`。The `style` parameter makes this method overload useful when `s` contains the string representation of a hexadecimal value, when the number system (decimal or hexadecimal) represented by `s` is known only at run time, or when you want to disallow white space or a sign symbol in `s`. 值而定`style`，則`s`參數可能包括下列項目：Depending on the value of `style`, the `s` parameter may include the following elements: [*ws*][*$*][*sign*][*digits*,]*digits*[.*fractional_digits*][E[*sign*]*exponential_digits*][*ws*][*ws*][*$*][*sign*][*digits*,]*digits*[.*fractional_digits*][E[*sign*]*exponential_digits*][*ws*] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 如果`style`包含，則`s`參數可能包含下列項目：If `style` includes , the `s` parameter may contain the following elements: (負號存在，是否`s`必須代表的值為零或方法會擲回。)若要明確定義的樣式項目，以及可出現在特定文化特性格式資訊`s`，使用方法。(If the negative sign is present, `s` must represent a value of zero or the method throws an .) (其實作的只會傳回本身。)(Its implementation of simply returns itself.) - 您可以傳遞指定其格式設定所要使用的文化特性的物件。You can pass a object that specifies the culture whose formatting is to be used. 其屬性提供格式設定資訊。Its property provides formatting information. - 您可以傳遞自訂實作。You can pass a custom implementation. 其方法必須具現化，並傳回提供格式設定資訊的物件。Its method must instantiate and return the object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`已`null`，則會使用目前的文化特性。If `provider` is `null`, the for the current culture is used. ## Examples 下列範例會具現化自訂的文化特性會使用兩個，再加上代表其正號 （+ +）。The following example instantiates a custom culture that uses two plus signs (++) as its positive sign. 然後它會呼叫方法來剖析字串的陣列，使用代表此自訂文化特性和區分文化特性的物件。It then calls the method to parse an array of strings by using objects that represent both this custom culture and the invariant culture. summary.span: 將這個執行個體的數值轉換為它的相等字串表示。

span.span: Converts the numeric value of this instance to its equivalent string representation.

returns.span: 這個執行個體值的字串表示，由 0 到 9 的數字順序所組成，沒有正負號或為零的前置字元。

span.span: The string representation of the value of this instance, which consists of a sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9, without a sign or leading zeros.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式預設值 （"G"或一般） 中的值使用的格式目前文化特性的物件。The method formats a value in the default ("G", or general) format by using the object of the current culture. 如果您想要指定不同的格式或文化特性，使用的其他多載方法，如下所示：If you want to specify a different format or culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|文化特性For culture|使用多載Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |預設值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|特定文化特性A specific culture|| |以特定格式A specific format|預設值 （目前） 的文化特性Default (current) culture|| |以特定格式A specific format|特定文化特性A specific culture|| ## Examples 下列範例會顯示使用預設值方法。The following example displays a value by using the default method. 它也會顯示的字串表示無法使用某些標準格式規範所產生的值。It also displays the string representations of the value that results from using some standard format specifiers. 範例會顯示使用 EN-US 文化特性的格式化慣例。The examples are displayed using the formatting conventions of the en-US culture. [!code-csharp[System.UInt16.ToString#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.uint16.tostring/cs/tostring1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.UInt16.ToString#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.uint16.tostring/vb/tostring1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式預設值 （"G"或一般） 中的值使用的格式指定文化特性的物件。The method formats a value in the default ("G", or general) format by using the object of a specified culture. 如果您想要指定不同的格式或目前的文化特性，使用的其他多載方法，如下所示：If you want to specify a different format or the current culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|文化特性For culture|使用多載Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |預設值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|預設值 （目前） 的文化特性Default (current) culture|| |以特定格式A specific format|預設值 （目前） 的文化特性Default (current) culture|| |以特定格式A specific format|特定文化特性A specific culture|| `provider`參數是實作。The `provider` parameter is an implementation. 其方法會傳回提供特定文化特性格式資訊的物件。Its method returns a object that provides culture-specific formatting information. 不過，沒有屬性的與一般的數值格式規範 ("G") 格式時，會使用。However, none of the properties of the are used when formatting with the general numeric format specifier ("G"). ## Examples 下列範例會使用數種格式提供者，包括一個而異的文化特性來格式化 16 位元帶正負號的整數值。The following example formats a 16-bit signed integer value by using several format providers, including one for the invariant culture. 此範例的輸出會說明所傳回格式化的字串方法是相同的格式提供者。The output from the example illustrates that the formatted string returned by the method is the same regardless of the format provider. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式中指定的格式，使用值物件，表示目前的文化特性的慣例。The method formats a value in a specified format by using a object that represents the conventions of the current culture. 如果您想要使用預設值 （"G"或一般） 格式或指定不同的文化特性，請使用的其他多載方法，如下所示：If you want to use the default ("G", or general) format or specify a different culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|文化特性For culture|使用多載Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |預設值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|預設值 （目前） 的文化特性Default (current) culture|| |預設值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|特定文化特性A specific culture|| |以特定格式A specific format|特定文化特性A specific culture|| `format`參數可以是任何有效[標準數值格式規範](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)，或任何組合[自訂數值格式規範](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。The `format` parameter can be any valid [standard numeric format specifier](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md), or any combination of [custom numeric format specifiers](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). 如果`format`等於是否`null`，目前的傳回值物件會以一般格式規範格式化 ("G")。If `format` is equal to or is `null`, the return value of the current object is formatted with the general format specifier ("G"). 如果`format`是任何其他值，則方法會擲回。If `format` is any other value, the method throws a . .NET Framework 會提供廣泛的格式化支援，這會在下列格式化主題中的更詳細地說明：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 如需有關數值格式規範的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)並[自訂數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 如需在.NET Framework 格式支援的詳細資訊，請參閱[格式化型別](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about support for formatting in the .NET Framework, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). 傳回字串的格式取決於目前的文化特性的物件。The format of the returned string is determined by the object for the current culture. 取決於`format`參數，這個物件可控制符號，例如群組分隔符號和小數點符號在輸出字串。Depending on the `format` parameter, this object controls symbols such as the group separator and the decimal point symbol in the output string. 若要提供目前的文化特性以外的文化特性格式資訊，請呼叫多載。To provide formatting information for cultures other than the current culture, call the overload. ## Examples 下列範例顯示使用每個標準格式字串和一些自訂格式字串的 16 位元不帶正負號的整數值。The following example displays a 16-bit unsigned integer value by using each standard format string and some custom format strings. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式中指定的格式，使用值指定文化特性的物件。The method formats a value in a specified format by using the object of a specified culture. 如果您想要使用預設格式或文化特性設定，使用的其他多載方法，如下所示：If you want to use default format or culture settings, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|文化特性For culture|使用多載Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |預設值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|預設值 （目前） 的文化特性Default (current) culture|| |預設值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|特定文化特性A specific culture|| |以特定格式A specific format|預設值 （目前） 的文化特性Default (current) culture|| `format`參數可以是任何有效[標準數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)，或任何組合[自訂數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。The `format` parameter can be any valid [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md), or any combination of [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). 如果`format`等於是否`null`，目前的傳回值物件會以一般格式規範格式化 ("G")。If `format` is equal to or is `null`, the return value of the current object is formatted with the general format specifier ("G"). 如果`format`是任何其他值，則方法會擲回。If `format` is any other value, the method throws a . .NET Framework 會提供廣泛的格式化支援，這會在下列格式化主題中的更詳細地說明：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 如需有關數值格式規範的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)並[自訂數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 如需有關格式的詳細資訊，請參閱[格式化型別](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about formatting, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). `provider`參數是實作。The `provider` parameter is an implementation. 其方法會傳回提供特定文化特性格式資訊的字串，這個方法所傳回的物件。Its method returns a object that provides culture-specific information about the format of the string returned by this method. 當叫用方法時，它會呼叫`provider`參數的方法並將它傳遞物件，表示型別。When the method is invoked, it calls the `provider` parameter's method and passes it a object that represents the type. 方法接著會傳回物件，提供資訊來格式化目前值，例如群組分隔符號或小數點符號。The method then returns the object that provides information for formatting the current value, such as the group separator symbol or the decimal point symbol. 若要使用的三種方式`provider`參數來提供格式設定資訊給方法：There are three ways to use the `provider` parameter to supply formatting information to the method: - 您可以傳遞物件，表示提供的格式資訊的文化特性。You can pass a object that represents the culture that supplies formatting information. 其方法會傳回提供用於該文化特性的數值格式資訊的物件。Its method returns the object that provides numeric formatting information for that culture. - 您可以傳遞的實際提供數值格式資訊的物件。You can pass the actual object that provides numeric formatting information. (其實作的只會傳回本身。)(Its implementation of just returns itself.) - 您可以傳遞自訂物件實作。You can pass a custom object that implements . 其方法具現化，並傳回提供格式設定資訊的物件。Its method instantiates and returns the object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`已`null`，傳回字串的格式根據目前文化特性的物件。If `provider` is `null`, the formatting of the returned string is based on the object of the current culture. ## Examples 下列範例顯示使用標準數值格式規範和特定的數字的 16 位元不帶正負號的整數值物件。The following example displays a 16-bit unsigned integer value by using the standard numeric format specifiers and a number of specific objects. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法就像方法，但是它不會擲回例外狀況如果轉換失敗。The method is like the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. 這個方法就不需要使用例外狀況處理來測試如果`s`無效，無法成功剖析。This method eliminates the need to use exception handling to test for a if `s` is invalid and cannot be successfully parsed. `s`參數應該是以下列形式的十進位數字的字串表示：The `s` parameter should be the string representation of a decimal number in the following form: [*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*][*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space.| |*簽署**sign*|選擇性正負號。An optional sign. 有效的符號字元由和目前文化特性的屬性。Valid sign characters are determined by the and properties of the current culture.| |*digits**digits*|範圍從 0 到 9 的十進位數字的序列。A sequence of decimal digits ranging from 0 to 9.| > [!NOTE] > 所指定的字串`s`參數不能包含任何的群組分隔符號或小數分隔符號，而且它不能有小數部分。The string specified by the `s` parameter cannot contain any group separators or decimal separator, and it cannot have a decimal portion. `s`參數會解譯使用樣式。The `s` parameter is interpreted by using the style. 除了十進位數字，只允許前置和尾端空格取代前置正負號。In addition to the decimal digits, only leading and trailing spaces with a leading sign are allowed. 明確地定義使用中會有特定文化特性格式資訊的樣式項目`s`，呼叫方法。To explicitly define the style elements with the culture-specific formatting information that can be present in `s`, call the method. `s`參數會剖析使用的格式設定資訊中目前系統文化特性的物件。The `s` parameter is parsed by using the formatting information in a object for the current system culture. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱。For more information, see . 這個多載會解譯中的所有位數`s`參數做為十進位數字。This overload interprets all digits in the `s` parameter as decimal digits. 若要剖析的十六進位數字的字串表示，呼叫改為多載。To parse the string representation of a hexadecimal number, call the overload instead. ## Examples 下列範例會呼叫針對字串陣列中每個項目執行一次的方法。The following example calls the method once for each element in a string array. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法就像方法，但是它不會擲回例外狀況如果轉換失敗。The method is like the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. 這個方法就不需要使用例外狀況處理來測試如果`s`無效，無法成功剖析...This method eliminates the need to use exception handling to test for a if `s` is invalid and cannot be parsed successfully.. `style`參數定義中允許的樣式項目 （例如空格或正的或負號）`s`剖析作業成功的參數。The `style` parameter defines the style elements (such as white space or a positive or negative sign) that are allowed in the `s` parameter for the parse operation to succeed. 它必須是從位元旗標的組合列舉型別。It must be a combination of bit flags from the enumeration. 值而定`style`，則`s`參數可能包括下列項目：Depending on the value of `style`, the `s` parameter may include the following elements: [*ws*][*$*][*sign*][*digits*,]*digits*[.*fractional_digits*][E[*sign*]*exponential_digits*][*ws*][*ws*][*$*][*sign*][*digits*,]*digits*[.*fractional_digits*][E[*sign*]*exponential_digits*][*ws*] 在方括號 （[和]） 是選用項目。Items in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 或者，如果`style`參數包含，則`s`參數可能包括下列項目：Or, if the `style` parameter includes , the `s` parameter may include the following elements: [*ws*]*hexdigits*[*ws*][*ws*]*hexdigits*[*ws*] 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. *ws**ws* 選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space. 空白字元可以出現在開頭`s`如果`style`包含旗標，或在結尾`s`如果`style`包含旗標。White space can appear at the start of `s` if `style` includes the flag, or at the end of `s` if `style` includes the flag. *$* 特定文化特性的貨幣符號。A culture-specific currency symbol. 在字串中的位置由定義的屬性所傳回的物件方法`provider`參數。Its position in the string is defined by the property of the object returned by the method of the `provider` parameter. 貨幣符號會出現在`s`如果`style`包含旗標。The currency symbol can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag. *簽署**sign* 選擇性正負號。An optional sign. 符號可以出現在開頭`s`如果`style`包含旗標，也可以顯示在結尾`s`如果`style`包含旗標。The sign can appear at the start of `s` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `s` if `style` includes the flag. 可用於括號`s`表示負值`style`包含旗標。Parentheses can be used in `s` to indicate a negative value if `style` includes the flag. 不過，如果負號存在，`s`只能表示值為零的剖析作業成功。However, if the negative sign is present, `s` can only represent the value zero for the parse operation to succeed. *digits**digits* 從 0 到 9 的數字序列。A sequence of digits from 0 through 9. *、**,* 特定文化特性的群組分隔符號。A culture-specific group separator. 指定的文化特性的群組分隔符號`provider`可以出現在`s`如果`style`包含旗標。The group separator of the culture specified by `provider` can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag. *.**.* 特定文化特性的貨幣符號。A culture-specific decimal point symbol. 指定的文化特性的小數點符號`provider`可以出現在`s`如果`style`包含旗標。The decimal point symbol of the culture specified by `provider` can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag. *fractional_digits**fractional_digits* 數字 0 的一或多個項目。One or more occurrences of the digit 0. 小數點後數字可以出現在`s`只有當`style`包含旗標。Fractional digits can appear in `s` only if `style` includes the flag. EE "E"或者"E"字元，表示代表的值時，會以指數 （科學記號） 標記法。The "e" or "E" character, which indicates that the value is represented in exponential (scientific) notation. `s`參數可代表指數標記法之數字，如果`style`包含旗標。The `s` parameter can represent a number in exponential notation if `style` includes the flag. *exponential_digits**exponential_digits* 從 0 到 9 的數字序列。A sequence of digits from 0 through 9. `s`參數可代表指數標記法之數字，如果`style`包含旗標。The `s` parameter can represent a number in exponential notation if `style` includes the flag. *hexdigits**hexdigits* 一連串的從 0 到 f 或 0 到 f 的十六進位數字A sequence of
